text:
The Clue Game: Congruent Triangles

In the Shapes and Designs unit we showed that two triangles were congruent by showing that corresponding angles and side lengths are equal. That is, if the corresponding sides and angles are equal, you can conclude that the triangles are congruent.

Examples for triangles ABC and RQP are shown below.

Since all corresponding parts are congruent, the two triangles are congruent.

Triangles ABC and RQP show a common way of marking congruent sides and angles. The sides with the same number of tic marks are congruent. The angles with the name number of arcs are congruent.

In past problems we looked at what information is needed to determine congruence. Here we will explore how much information is needed.
